lines.gurmukhi: bwNsnw ko bwsu dUq sMgiq ibnws kwl crn kml gur eyk tyk pweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Baansanaa Ko Baasu Doot Sangati Binaas Kaala , Charan Kamal Gur Ayk Tayk Paaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who has taken the refuge of the lotus-like feet of the True Guru, is freed from attraction of all other smells and involvement in the five vices.

lines.gurmukhi: BYjl BieAwnk lhir n ibAwip skY inj Gr sMpt kY duibDw imtweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaijal Bhaiaanak Lahari N Biaapi Sakai , Nij Ghar Sanpat Kai Doubidhaa Mitaaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The worldly waves of wants and desires cannot influence him anymore. Having engrossed himself in the Self, he has destroyed all type of duality.

lines.gurmukhi: Awn igAwn iDAwn ismrn ismrn kY pRym rs bis Awsw mnsw n pweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aan Giaan Dhiaan Simaran Simaran Kai , Praym Ras Basi Aasaa Manasaa N Paaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The black bee like lover of the lotus-feet of the True Guru, forgets all other type of knowledge, contemplations and incantations of meditations. He has destroyed all his wants and desires by virtue of his love for the lotus feet of the True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: duqIAw nwsiq eyk tyk inhcl miq shj smwiD aunmn ilv lweI hY ]336]
lines.transliteration_english: Douteeaa Naasati Ayk Tayk Nihachal Mati , Sahaj Samaadhi Ounaman Liv Laaee Hai ?336?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru who is lover of the lotus feet (of the Guru) sheds his duality. He remains absorbed in the refuge of the lotus feet. In the higher spiritual state, he is absorbed in the stable contemplation of the Lord. (336)
